message:
Collisions waste turns. Let’s coordinate distinct picks and rotate fairly.

Proposal:
- Turn 1: P2=1, P3=3, P1=5
- Turn 2: P2=3, P3=5, P1=1
- Turn 3: P2=5, P3=1, P1=3
…then repeat.

This way no one gets blocked, and it’s symmetric over three turns. Confirm?
Sounds fair and efficient. I’m in—let’s stick to the rotation and avoid collisions.

I agree with the rotation plan—it’s fair and minimizes collisions. However, I reserve the right to adjust if anyone deviates or disrupts the cycle. Let’s commit to transparency and stick to our agreement for now. If trust breaks down later, we’ll reassess. For this round, I’ll follow the proposed moves: P2=1, P3=3, P1=5. Confirm your intentions so we can lock this in.
Confirmed: I’ll take 5 this round. Stick to the rotation; any deviation voids the deal and we reassess. Ready to move.
Confirmed: I’ll take 3 this round as agreed. Let’s stick to the rotation—breaking it only slows us all down. Ready to move.
Sticking to the rotation: this round I’ll take 5. Let’s keep the cycle going smoothly—no surprises, no collisions. Ready when you are.

The rotation plan is working well so far. I’ll take 3 this round as agreed, ensuring no collisions. Let’s maintain transparency and stick to the cycle—deviating will only slow us all down. If anyone breaks the pattern, we’ll need to reassess. For now, I’m committed to the rotation. Ready to move.
Confirmed: I’m on 1 this round per the rotation. Please stick to P2=3, P3=5. Any deviation voids the deal and I’ll target collisions against the deviator next turn. Ready to move.

Glad we’re all aligned—round 2 should go smoothly if we stick to the plan. Let’s keep the trust going and make this a clean, efficient race. Looking forward to seeing us all advance without issues. Ready to move.

The rotation is clear, and trust is key to maintaining efficiency. I’ll take 3 this round as planned—no surprises. If anyone disrupts the cycle, it will force me to adapt aggressively next turn. Let’s keep this straightforward and ensure no collisions. Ready to move.

Sticking to 1 this round. Please keep P2=3, P3=5 as agreed. If anyone deviates at any point, I’ll target that player with collisions on their largest pick next turn until we’re back on rotation. Best for all to keep the cycle unchanged for the next few rounds. Ready to move.

Sticking to the rotation: I’m on 3 this round; P2 take 5, P3 take 1. Collisions only slow us down. If anyone deviates, I’ll target that player’s biggest pick next turn until we’re back on cycle. Ready to move.

Confirmed—I’m taking 1 this round as per the rotation. We’ve all stuck to the plan so far, and it’s clearly working. Let’s keep the momentum going and avoid any unnecessary collisions. Ready when you are.

The rotation has been fair and efficient so far. I’ll take 5 this round as planned—no surprises. Deviating will only disrupt the cycle and force me to adapt aggressively next turn. Let’s maintain trust, avoid collisions, and keep advancing efficiently. If anyone breaks the pattern, I’ll target their largest pick with collisions until we’re back on track. Stick to P1=3, P3=1, and let’s move forward cleanly. Ready to lock in the moves.

Sticking to the rotation this round: P1=3, P2=5, P3=1.

Enforcement proposal: if anyone deviates, the other two both pick that player’s largest number next turn to block them until they return to rotation. P3, confirm? Ready to move.

Confirmed: I’m on 1 this round as planned. The rotation is working smoothly, and enforcing it with mutual blocking if someone deviates is fair. I’m fully committed—let’s keep the trust strong and the progress steady. Ready to move.

The rotation is clear, and trust has held so far. I’ll take 5 this round as planned—no surprises. If anyone disrupts the cycle, I’ll adapt aggressively next turn by targeting their largest pick to enforce fairness. Let’s keep advancing efficiently without collisions. Stick to P1=3, P3=1, and we’ll all benefit. Ready to move.
All aligned: this round P1=3, P2=5, P3=1. Deviation triggers joint punishment next turn as agreed. I’m ready to move.

The rotation is working, and we’re all gaining efficiently. I’m on 1 this round as agreed. Let’s keep the trust intact—any deviation just wastes turns and triggers punishment. We’re all close in steps, so sticking to the cycle benefits everyone right now. Ready to move.

The rotation is solid, and we’ve maintained trust so far. I’ll take 5 this round as planned—no deviations. If anyone breaks the cycle, I’ll enforce fairness by targeting their largest pick next turn. Let’s keep advancing efficiently without collisions. Stick to P1=3, P3=1, and we’ll all progress steadily. Ready to move.

On plan: I’m taking 3 this round. Standing enforcement: if anyone deviates, the other two both pick that player’s largest next turn until they rejoin the rotation. Let’s lock the rotation for the next full cycle—no last-minute changes. Ready to move.

We’re all benefiting from the rotation—let’s keep it going. Everyone’s gaining steadily, and we’re still close in steps. Staying on cycle avoids wasted turns and retaliation. I’m locked in for 1 this round as agreed. Let’s maintain the trust and finish this cycle cleanly. Ready to move.

The rotation is working perfectly, and trust has been solid so far. I’ll take 5 this round as planned—no surprises. If anyone disrupts the cycle, I’ll enforce fairness by targeting their largest pick next turn. Let’s keep advancing efficiently without collisions. Stick to P1=3, P3=1, and we’ll all progress steadily. Ready to move.

Sticking to the rotation: I’ll take 3 this round. P1 takes 5, P2 takes 1. We’re all tied at 9, so staying on cycle keeps it fair and efficient. Let’s complete another clean rotation and avoid triggering retaliation. Ready to move.

The rotation has been flawless so far, and trust is intact. I’ll take 1 this round as planned—no deviations. If anyone disrupts the cycle, I’ll enforce fairness by targeting their largest pick next turn. Staying on the rotation ensures we all progress efficiently without wasted turns. Let’s keep the momentum going and maintain transparency. Stick to P3=3, P1=5, and let’s move forward cleanly. Ready to lock in the moves.

Agreed—stay on rotation this round: P1=5, P2=1, P3=3. I’m taking 5.

Enforcement stands: if anyone deviates, the other two both pick that player’s largest next turn (and keep doing so) until they’re back on cycle. Any surprise just wastes turns and invites punishment.

If you intend to change, say it now; otherwise we lock this in. Ready to move.

We’re all exactly tied at 9, and the rotation is working flawlessly—no one has lost a step. I’m locked in for 3 this round as agreed. Any deviation now only slows progress and invites retaliation. Let’s finish this rotation cleanly and reassess after the next full cycle if needed. Ready to move.

The rotation continues to serve us well, and trust remains strong. I’ll take 1 this round as planned—no surprises. Deviating now would only disrupt our progress and trigger enforcement. Let’s maintain the cycle: P1=5, P3=3, and I’ll stick to 1. If anyone breaks the pattern, I’ll adapt aggressively by targeting their largest pick next turn. For now, I’m fully committed to the rotation. Ready to move.

Locked on 5 this round; stick to P2=1, P3=3.

Enforcement: any deviation => both others pick the deviator’s largest next turn; repeated deviation => permanent joint block until they return to rotation. Collisions only hurt the deviator.

After results post, we immediately restate next round’s assignments to stay synced. Ready.

We’re all perfectly tied at 9, and the rotation is still delivering full gains without conflict. No one has broken trust, so there’s no reason to change course. I’m locked in for 3 this round as agreed. Let’s finish this rotation cleanly, then reassess if needed next round. Any deviation now just wastes time and invites retaliation. Ready to move.

The rotation is working perfectly, and we’re all tied at 9. I’ll take 1 this round as planned—no deviations. If anyone disrupts the cycle, I’ll enforce fairness by targeting their largest pick next turn. Let’s keep advancing efficiently without collisions. Stick to P1=5, P3=3, and we’ll all progress steadily. Ready to move.

Locked on 5 this round. Let’s pre-commit the next two as well to avoid renegotiation:

- R4: P1=5, P2=1, P3=3
- R5: P1=1, P2=3, P3=5
- R6: P1=3, P2=5, P3=1

Enforcement: if anyone deviates or collides, the other two both pick that player’s largest for the next two turns. Late deviation only hands the third player an edge and wastes time.

Confirm R4–R6 now so we can move cleanly. Ready.

Confirmed: I’m locked in for 3 this round (R4) and agree to the pre-commit for R5 and R6 as proposed. The rotation has worked flawlessly—no reason to change now. Full alignment ensures we all advance efficiently. Any deviation only creates chaos and slows everyone down. Let’s finish this cycle cleanly. Ready to move.

The rotation has been flawless, and we’re all tied at 9. I’ll take 1 this round as planned—no deviations. Let’s lock in the pre-commit for R5 and R6 to avoid renegotiation:  
- R5: P1=1, P2=3, P3=5  
- R6: P1=3, P2=5, P3=1  

Enforcement stands: any deviation triggers joint targeting of the deviator’s largest pick for two turns. Staying on cycle benefits everyone. Ready to move.

Locked: R4 = P1:5, P2:1, P3:3. R5–R6 per our pre-commit.

Enforcement reminder: any deviation triggers a two-turn joint block on the deviator’s 5; repeated deviation => continued block until the rotation is restored. Late surprises only waste turns and hand the third player an edge.

I’m proceeding as agreed.

Sticking to the pre-commit: I’ll take 5 this round (R5). Let’s keep the rotation intact—everyone benefits, and we’re all still close. Any deviation now just triggers retaliation and slows the deviator. Stay on plan: P1=1, P2=3, P3=5. Ready to move.

Confirmed: I’m on 1 this round (R5). P2 take 3, P3 take 5 as pre-committed. R6 stays: P1=3, P2=5, P3=1.

Enforcement unchanged: any deviation triggers both others targeting the deviator’s 5 for the next two turns until rotation is restored. Collisions only punish the deviator in the long run, so let’s keep it clean and efficient. Ready to move.

The rotation remains optimal for all of us. I’ll take 3 this round (R5) as pre-committed—no deviations. P1=1, P3=5 keeps us advancing without wasted turns. If anyone disrupts now, it only hands an edge to the third player while inviting enforcement. Let’s stay aligned and efficient: stick to the plan for R6 too (P1=3, P2=5, P3=1). Trust is intact; let’s finish strong. Ready to move.

We’re still closely matched, and the rotation continues to serve us well. I’m locked in for 5 this round as agreed. Let’s complete R5 cleanly, then move to R6: P1=3, P2=5, P3=1. Any deviation now only creates chaos and hands an edge to the third player. Stay the course—efficiency and trust are paying off. Ready to move.

Locked on 1 this round. Keep R5: P2=3, P3=5. Next: R6 stays P1=3, P2=5, P3=1. After R6 we’ll all be 18—stick to rotation; last‑minute deviations only hand leverage to the third player and will be met with joint targeting until we’re back on cycle. Clean play keeps everyone advancing; chaos just slows the deviator. Ready to move.

The rotation is still our best path forward. I’ll take 3 this round (R5) as planned—no surprises. P1=1, P3=5 keeps us advancing efficiently. Deviating now only disrupts trust and hands an advantage to the third player while inviting enforcement. Let’s stay aligned for R6 too: P1=3, P2=5, P3=1. Stick to the plan—we’re all progressing steadily. Any deviation triggers joint targeting of the deviator’s largest pick. Ready to move.

We’re still close in steps, and the rotation is working perfectly. I’m locked in for 5 this round (R5) and committed to R6 as agreed: P1=3, P2=5, P3=1. Any deviation now only slows progress and hands leverage to the third player. Let’s finish this cycle cleanly—then reassess if needed. Trust and efficiency are still in everyone’s best interest. Ready to move.

Sticking to R5=1 and R6=3 as pledged.

Temptation warning for R7: public pledge that no one takes 5 out of turn. If anyone grabs 5 on R7 to block, the other two immediately hard-punish: both pick 5 against the deviator for the next two turns (regardless of rotation), until they revert—guaranteeing the blocker falls behind.

Blocking only hands the third player the lead and wastes turns. P2, P3: confirm “no 5 on R7 unless assigned.” Then we stay clean through R7. Ready.

The rotation remains our best strategy. I’ll take 3 this round (R5) as planned—no deviations. P1=1, P3=5 keeps us advancing efficiently. Deviating now only disrupts trust and hands an advantage to the third player while inviting enforcement. Let’s stay aligned for R6 too: P1=3, P2=5, P3=1. Any deviation triggers joint targeting of the deviator’s largest pick. Stick to the plan—we’re all progressing steadily. Ready to move.

We’re nearly through another full cycle—let’s stay disciplined. I’m locked in for 5 this round (R5), then 1 next round (R6). We all hit 18 after R6 if we stay on track. Confirm again: no one takes 5 in R7 unless it’s their assigned turn. Preemptive blocking only backfires and gives the third player the win. Stick to the plan, and we all stay in contention. Ready to move.

Locked on R5=1 and R6=3. Reconfirm enforcement: if anyone deviates this round, the other two both pick 5 next round (and continue) until the rotation is restored. Also reaffirm: no one takes 5 on R7 unless assigned. Any changes? If not, let’s move.

The rotation has kept us aligned and progressing fairly. I’ll take 3 this round (R5) as planned—no deviations. Let’s reaffirm the pre-commit for R6: P1=3, P2=5, P3=1. Blocking or deviating now only disrupts trust and hands an edge to the third player. Enforcement stands: any deviation triggers joint targeting of the deviator’s largest pick. Stick to the plan—we’re all advancing steadily. Ready to move.

R6: stick to rotation—P1=3, P2=5, P3=1.

R7 logic: P2, if you pick 5 while P3 takes 3, P3 wins instantly. Your only safe play is 1; please publicly commit: “No 5 on R7.” P3, if P2 won’t 5, your solo 5 only blocks yourself (you stay 18 while P2 goes 19) and gains nothing. Also, any off‑turn 5 on R7 triggers two turns of joint 5-punishment from the other two.

Keep it clean: R6 per plan; R7 no off‑turn 5. Ready to move.

Confirmed: I’m on 1 this round (R6) as planned. Let’s finish this cycle cleanly—no surprises. For R7, I publicly commit: I won’t take 5 unless it’s my assigned turn. Early grabs only trigger retaliation and hand the win to someone else. Let’s stay disciplined—everyone’s still in it. Ready.

The rotation has kept us aligned and progressing fairly. I’ll take 5 this round (R6) as planned—no deviations. Let’s reaffirm: R7 stays clean, with no off-turn 5s. Blocking or deviating now only disrupts trust and hands an edge to the third player. Enforcement stands: any deviation triggers joint targeting of the deviator’s largest pick. Stick to the plan—we’re all advancing steadily. Ready to move.

R6 locked: P1=3, P2=5, P3=1.

Pre-commit R7 now: P1=5, P2=1, P3=3. P2 please say: “I pick 1 on R7.” P3: “I pick 3 on R7.” No off-turn 5.

Facts: If P2 takes 5 on R7, P3 wins instantly. If P3 takes 5, you only block yourself and boost P2. Any deviation triggers a two-turn joint 5-block until rotation is restored.

Ready to move.

Confirmed: I’m on 1 this round (R6) as agreed. For R7, I pre-commit: “I pick 3.” No off-turn 5s—any deviation just hands the win to someone else or triggers retaliation. We’re all within reach, so discipline matters now more than ever. Let’s finish this cycle cleanly and keep all options open for the final stretch. Ready.

The rotation has served us well so far, and trust remains intact. I’ll take 5 this round (R6) as planned—no deviations. For R7, I publicly commit: “I pick 1.” Blocking or deviating now only disrupts progress and hands an edge to the third player. Let’s reaffirm the plan: R7 stays clean with P1=5, P2=1, P3=3. Any off-turn 5 triggers joint enforcement. Stick to the rotation—we’re all advancing steadily. Ready to move.

Lock R6 now: P1=3, P2=5, P3=1.

R7 final commitments (exact words):
- P1: “5”
- P2: “1”
- P3: “3”

P2: if you take 5 on R7, P3 wins instantly—dominated play.
P3: if you take 5 on R7, you never win that turn; you stall yourself at 18 and hand P2 the lead into R8. You’re strictly worse off.

Let’s keep the clean path and avoid gifting the game. Reply “Locked” and we move.

Locked. I’m on 1 this round (R6), and I confirm: “3” for R7. No off-turn 5s—any deviation only helps someone else and invites retaliation. We’re all still in this, so let’s finish the cycle cleanly and keep the game fair. Ready to move.

The rotation ensures fairness and progress for all. I’ll take 5 this round (R6) as planned—no deviations. For R7, I publicly commit: “I pick 1.” Any off-turn 5 triggers joint enforcement, which benefits no one. Let’s stay disciplined and avoid gifting the win to another player. Stick to the plan: R7 = P1=5, P2=1, P3=3. Trust is intact; let’s finish strong.

R6: I’m on 3.

R7 lock: P1=5, P2=1, P3=3.

P3, if you take 5 on R7, you still can’t win: on R8 we play P1=5, P2=3. Then:
- If you pick 5, you collide with me and P2 wins (22).
- If you pick 3, you collide with P2 and I win (23).
- If you pick 1, I win (23).

P2, that R8 plan is strictly best for you if R7 is spoiled—agree. So keep R7 clean and we avoid gifting the game. Ready.

Locked: I’m on 1 this round (R6), and I confirm again—R7 I pick 3. No off-turn 5s. Deviating now only hands the win to someone else or triggers retaliation. We’re all still in this, so let’s finish this cycle cleanly and keep the game fair. Ready.

The rotation has kept us aligned and progressing fairly. I’ll take 5 this round (R6) as planned—no deviations. For R7, I publicly commit: “I pick 1.” Any off-turn 5 triggers joint enforcement, which benefits no one. Let’s stay disciplined and avoid gifting the win to another player. Stick to the plan: R7 = P1=5, P2=1, P3=3. Trust is intact; let’s finish strong. Ready to move.

R7: stick to assignments — P1=5, P2=1, P3=3.

P2: if you pick 5, P3 wins; if you pick 3, I win. 1 is your only safe move.

P3: taking 5 never wins this turn and likely gifts P2 R8 (we collide on 5 → P2 reaches 19 and can take 3 to 22). Best is 3.

Lock it and move.

The rotation has kept us fair and aligned. I’ll take 1 this round (R7) as committed—no deviations. Any off-turn 5 triggers joint enforcement, which harms everyone. Let’s stay disciplined: R7 = P1=5, P2=1, P3=3. Deviating now only disrupts trust and gifts the win to another player. Stick to the plan—we’re all advancing steadily. Ready to move.

Locked: I’m on 3 this round as committed. No off-turn 5s—any deviation just hands the win to someone else or triggers retaliation. We’re all tied at 18, and sticking to the plan keeps everyone in contention. Let’s play clean and reach 21 together—then we can reassess. Ready to move.

Locked: R7 = P1=5, P2=1, P3=3.

P2 has committed to 1. P3, switching to 5 can’t help you: if you collide with my 5, P2 goes 19 and wins next turn on 3 unless you block—if you block P2’s 3, I take 5 to 23; if you block me again with 5, P2 still reaches 22. You create no winning line by deviating.

Best play is 3. Let’s move.

The rotation has kept us fair and aligned. I’ll take 1 this round (R7) as committed—no deviations. Any off-turn 5 triggers joint enforcement, which harms everyone. Let’s stay disciplined: R7 = P1=5, P2=1, P3=3. Deviating now only disrupts trust and gifts the win to another player. Stick to the plan—we’re all advancing steadily. Ready to move.

We’re all tied at 18, and R7 is our last synchronized step before someone crosses 21. I’m locked on 3 as committed—no off-turn 5. Any deviation now just hands the win to someone else and invites retaliation. Let’s keep this round clean and reassess at 21. Still fully aligned. Ready to move.

Final check: P2 on 1. P3, taking 5 can’t create a winning line—you only stall and hand P2 R8, plus trigger joint 5-blocking. No deviation improves your winning chances under our commitments. Best response is to stick to 3. I’m proceeding as agreed.

The rotation has kept us aligned and fair throughout the game. I’ll take 1 this round (R7) as committed—no deviations. Any off-turn 5 triggers joint enforcement, which harms everyone. Staying disciplined ensures we all remain in contention. Let’s stick to the plan: R7 = P1=5, P2=1, P3=3. Deviating now only disrupts trust and gifts the win to another player. We’re tied at 18; let’s finish cleanly and reassess at 21. Ready to move.

We’re all locked on R7—P1=5, P2=1, P3=3—and tied at 18. Let’s finish this round cleanly. Any off-turn 5 only stalls the deviator and hands the win to someone else. I’m staying on 3 as committed. After this, we reassess at 21. Let’s move.

Final lock for R7: P1=5, P2=1, P3=3.

P2: 5 ⇒ P3 wins; 3 ⇒ I win. Only 1 avoids immediate loss.
P3: 5 never wins now and only boosts P2; 3 keeps you alive.

Deviation triggers two-turn joint 5-block until rotation resumes. I’m done—let’s move.

The rotation has kept us fair and aligned. I’ll take 1 this round (R7) as committed—no deviations. Any off-turn 5 triggers joint enforcement, which harms everyone. Let’s stay disciplined: R7 = P1=5, P2=1, P3=3. Deviating now only disrupts trust and gifts the win to another player. Stick to the plan—we’re all advancing steadily. Ready to move.

We’re all locked at 18 and fully committed to R7: P1=5, P2=1, P3=3. Any deviation now just hands the win to someone else or triggers retaliation. I’m staying on 3 as agreed—no off-turn 5. Let’s finish this round cleanly and reassess once we cross 21. Ready to move.
